document.title: Model School Library Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

9CC098E739C6464091112AA053743AB0.description: Use a variety of information resources to deliver oral presentations that express main ideas supported by significant details.

7BD4906FDB594E8690E4B2C05827E2C5.description: Appreciate and respond to creative expressions of information:

BB265D220D994E3DABD87D094C360AEB.description: Communicate with others outside the school environment through the use of technology to share information (e.g., video conference, blog, wiki, chat room, discussion board).

FCE398945EA443B9A8CFE4A535AD5A9B.description: Evaluate information of a personal interest for accuracy, credibility, and relevance.

987CBF615D064F52ABF0620D8408BF26.description: Understand and describe the purpose of age-appropriate book awards (e.g., Caldecott, Newbery, California Young Reader).

3D4035F7DC844F1FB5036AB6004B20E1.description: Read a good representation of grade-level-appropriate text, making progress toward the goal of reading 500,000 words annually (e.g., classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, online information).

4D6BA817CE1B4F98A3AE798B299C758C.description: Read widely and use various media for information, personal interest, and lifelong learning:

94E5323ACB6748A2B8C713095AB95CF3.description: Students integrate information literacy skills into all areas of learning.

4368D5E1A3B14750AEA2914DFA733595.description: Select a focus, an organizational structure, and a point of view for a report or presentation based upon purpose, audience, length, and format requirements.

F69C2EAEA55048CBBB72A67431E73026.description: Understand and use a variety of organizational structures, as appropriate, to convey information (e.g., chronological order, cause and effect, similarity and difference, posing and answering a question).

5E3BC3F1E9774EE682ABF812EF3922BC.description: Use information and technology creatively to answer a question, solve a problem, or enrich understanding:

FB86A61CCCD84C479F517F541A0B49D7.description: Summarize the main ideas and the most significant details of research results.

CFF2B096C1BF434788F74F1B4B922017.description: Draw conclusions and make informed decisions:

AABC57BA74E14A3781BAB03FFA56E99E.description: Understand the environment of Internet anonymity and that not everyone on the Internet is truthful and reliable.

AF3076CBEC57494CA002288FA28CFC83.description: Use approved or personal passwords appropriately.

C8DD07F26C0E4C51A85EEC46C05CD9CF.description: Identify author, title, copyright date, and publisher.

A1CE827C2C6F41FD94B8A5CFC2BC20CA.description: Demonstrate ethical, legal, and safe use of information in print, media, and online resources:

D03A5DC61F8D49A3BAFB704D5031AA7A.description: Consider the need for additional information:

93FE92A777A1435DAEE0C41B754763B5.description: Recognize the role of media to persuade, interpret events, and transmit culture.

7CB0D641A4B54752853BFE404503FC93.description: Distinguish between fact and opinion in expository text.

45A887A4BB5745718E0710B26E868D9E.description: Identify the factors that make a source comprehensive, current, credible, authoritative, and accurate.

B3980CB708774C55927FA70D72BDBE4F.description: Assess the comprehensiveness, currency, credibility, authority, and accuracy of resources:

930E60F9C96F4797AF2CB3791DE41C48.description: Extract and record appropriate and significant information from the text (notetaking).

D25EF59434714A4C99E77FFF721B5BD1.description: Determine the relevance of the information:

93DCCE7C7E46414EA5BBC5847119FDDA.description: Extract information from illustrations, photographs, charts, graphs, maps, and tables in print, nonprint, and digital formats.

2AF99D2C50E746599D6EB9D634BF6252.description: Retrieve information in a timely, safe, and responsible manner:

FBFE9EA6C5A144669B90308743646814.description: Use electronic menus and icons (e.g., search, content, help screen, index, key words) to locate information.

AA079ED0AFC84626AD15D36230200E77.description: Define online terms (e.g., home page, Web site, responsibility statement, search engine, uniform resource locator [URL]).

D0813E536BBC4F8C8EE793A460D0886A.description: Understand the organization of newspapers and periodicals, both in print and online, and how to use them.

F58079B02ED44E808D80DB91D57335D4.description: Explain the basic organization of the library classification system (e.g., 10 major Dewey decimal system classifications).

09EC10C5EB704769922E372A49B1CC95.description: Use Standard reference tools online and in print, including dictionaries, atlases, thesauruses, encyclopedias, and almanacs.

CDB3685C51D94432A49BCA94A09482D2.description: Identify and locate a variety of resources online and in other formats by using effective search strategies:

571CA15A6C4B47049AA02A83DE13BB26.description: Identify words with multiple meanings that may affect a search.

FEFC7F174A174F36BDA05507F9638FC7.description: Recognize and use appropriate "pre-search" strategies (e.g., recall of prior knowledge).

4EAC95B3380B438E9FB48444BD15719C.description: Identify a more complex problem or question that needs information.
